sen.j: 藤原 魚名（ふじわら の うおな、養老5年（721年） - 延暦2年7月25日 (旧暦)（783年8月31日））は、奈良時代の公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Uona (July 25, AD 721 to August 31, AD 783) was a high court noble in the Nara period.

sen.j: 藤原北家に属し、藤原房前の五男。
sen.e: Belonging to the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, he was the fifth son of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.
He belonged to the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan and was the fifth son of FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.

sen.j: 正二位、左大臣。
sen.e: He was the Senior Second Court Rank and Minister of the Left.

sen.j: 川辺大臣と号す。

sen.j: 称徳天皇の死亡時参議であった魚名は藤原永手・藤原良継・藤原百川らと光仁天皇を擁立、道鏡を排除し、急速に頭角を現した。
sen.e: When Emperor Shotoku died, Uona, who was the Sangi (councilor) at the time, with FUJIWARA no Nagate, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu, FUJIWARA no Momokawa et al, enthroned Emperor and expelled Dokyo, and thus became rapidly an important role.

When Emperor Shotoku died, Uona quickly started showing his ability after Usano, who was the Sangi (councilor) at the time, enthroned Emperor Konin with FUJIWARA no Nagate, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu as well as FUJIWARA no Momokawa and expelled Dokyo.
sen.cmt: 文の全体を訂正しました。
sen.e: When Emperor Shotoku died, Uona quickly started showing his ability after Usano, who was the Sangi (councilor) at the time, enthroned Emperor Konin with FUJIWARA no Nagate, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu as well as FUJIWARA no Momokawa and expelled Dokyo.

sen.j: 魚名は光仁天皇の信任が非常に厚く「忠臣」という官位が与えられるほどであった。
sen.e: Uona was very trusted by Emperor Konin to the extent that he was granted the official rank called "Loyal Retainer".
Uona gained tremendous trust from Emperor Konin and was granted the official rank called "Loyal Retainer."

sen.j: 大阪府豊中市に鎮座する服部天神宮の前身の一つが魚名の墓と言われ、境内には今もが残る。
sen.e: It is said that one of the former Hattori-tenjingu Shrines, which were enshrined in Toyonaka City, Osaka Prefecture, was a grave of Uona, and it is now still remaining in the precincts.

sen.e: Entering the Heian period, Uona's descendants became middle rank of nobles who held local government positions etc. successively, without any person listed among the high court nobles for a long time.
